name: Sam Hopkins 0001
content: index Sam Hopkins Home Publications Teaching Grab Bag algorithms, theory of machine learning, semidefinite programming, sum of squares method, bicycles. he/him. I am a theoretical computer scientist and Assistant Professor at MIT, in the Theory of Computing group in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, where I hold the Jamieson Career Development Chair. Previously, I was a Miller fellow in the theory of computing group at UC Berkeley, hosted by Prasad Raghavendra and Luca Trevisan. Before that, I got my PhD at Cornell, advised by David Steurer. My papers on Google Scholar and some talks on YouTube I am proud to advise: Prashanti Anderson Amit Rajaraman Ittai Rubinstein I like bikes. I am Samuel B. Hopkins. Maybe you are looking for Samuel Francis Hopkins? Contact Office: G666, Stata Center (Building 32), MIT samhop at mit.edu photo credit: Michael Grimmett
